awd_titl_txt: Symposium on Beyond Graphene: 2D Atomic Layers from Layered Materials,to be held at Pennsylvania State University, April 1-2, 2014
awd_abstract_narration: The proposed project seeks financial support to students and young researchers to attend the 2013 MRS-Spring Symposium O on 2D Atomic layers from Layered Materials. Some of the budget will also be used to partially support meeting registrations for the six of the youngest invited speakers. The meeting will take place in San Francisco from April 3 to 5, 2013. It is the first in its series at the MRS and  is designed to foster the emerging field of 2D-layered materials, focusing on materials different from graphene such as BN, MoS2, WS2, MoO3, BC2N, MoSe2, WSe2. The program includes invited presentations by active, international experts in the field as well as regular contributions, to enable dissemination of the current ideas and to foster critical discussion on the diverse applications.
org_div_long_name: Division of Electrical, Communications and Cyber Systems

por.por_cntn:
The workshop entitled “Graphene and Beyond Graphene: From Atoms to Applications” took place at Penn State University (April 1-2, 2014). It was extremely important for the professional development of students in areas of engineering, physics and chemistry. The speakers showed new results (some of them not yet published), and the tutorials were very important for researchers entering the 2D field. We satisfactorily supported students and young researchers (postdocs and young faculty) to attend the workshop. 

At the symposia the session topics included: General properties of 2D layered oxides, nitrides, sulfides and other compositions, Creation of atomic layers from layered materials via chemical routes and exfoliation, Growth of atomic layers of various compositions by vapor phase techniques, Chemical modification and doping of atomic layers extracted from layered structures, Structural and electronic characterization of 2D atomic layers, Exploration of new physics and novel behavior in 2D atomic layers, Theory, modeling and prediction of properties of isolated 2D atomic layers, and Applications of atomic layers extracted from layered compounds. More than 70 people participated in the symposium and the symposium was targeted to train students, and young researchers in the area of 2D Materials. In addition, a survey about the workshop was filled by half of the attendees and the general view of the workshop was excellent and of extremely high quality.

We have used a web page to promote the workshop. The site provides the whole scientific program. In addition, each invited speaker could be directed to their own website in order to be contacted. A summary of the workshop is also provided on the webpage. The site address is:

http://www.mri.psu.edu/news/events/beyond-graphene/
